children.text: It sorts them and checks if any two consecutive elements have the next one less than double the previous and are not equal. If so, it prints "YES" and exits; else "NO". The second file (codeforces_147_A) processes a string.

children.text: It takes each character, and if it's a Latin letter, it appends a space before it unless the previous character was also a letter. It ignores non-Latin letters except punctuation (.,!?), which are added as is. The output is the transformed string. The third file (codeforces_8_B) takes a string of directions (L, R, U, D) and tracks the path. It records all positions (including start) and then checks if any two positions (except those three steps apart?) are too close (distance <=1 in one axis and 0 in the other). If any such pair exists, it outputs "BUG"; else "OK".
children.label: mental_execution
